backtesting_server.main

Module for uploading backtesting results to MySQL server.

Created on Tuesday 19th March 2024. @author: Harry New

Module Contents

class backtesting_server.main.BacktestingServer(standard_details: dict, sql_details: dict)[source]

Object representing the SQL server, allowing users to interact without having to directly connect. - Handles backtesting strategies. - Allows results to be uploaded.

connect(database: str) → tuple[paramiko.Channel, pymysql.cursors.Cursor] | tuple[None, None][source]

Connecting to MySQL server using SSH.

Parameters:

database (str) – Name of database to connect to.

Returns:

  • paramiko.Channel – Channel to MySQL server.

  • pymysql.cursors.Cursor – Cursor to execute SQL queries.

upload_historical_data(instrument: ig_package.Instrument, dataset: pandas.DataFrame) → None[source]

Uploading historical data to the backtesting server.

Parameters:

  • instrument (ig_package.Instrument) – Instrument the historical data corresponds to.

  • dataset (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing the data to be uploaded.

_check_historical_data_summary_exists() → bool[source]

Checking if the historical data summary table exists on the MySQL server.

Returns:

Depending on whether the summary table exists or not.

Return type:

bool

_check_instrument_in_historical_data(instrument: ig_package.Instrument) → bool[source]

Checking if instrument is already in historical data.

Parameters:

instrument (ig_package.Instrument) – Instrument to be checked.

Returns:

Boolean depending if instrument is present in historical data.

Return type:

bool

_create_historical_data_summary() → None[source]

Creating the historical data summary on the MySQL server.

_add_historical_data_summary(instrument: ig_package.Instrument) → None[source]

Adding instrument to the historical data summary and creating new table for historical data.

Parameters:

instrument (ig_package.Instrument) – Instrument to add to the historical data summary.
